featuredItems.title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
featuredItems.author: Martin Kleppmann
featuredItems.description: The absolute bible for backend engineering. It bridges the gap between theory and practice for distributed systems.

featuredItems.title: Obsidian
featuredItems.author: Knowledge Base
featuredItems.description: My second brain. The local-first, markdown-based approach makes it indispensable for engineering notes and long-term knowledge retention.

gridItems.title: Hussein Nasser
gridItems.subtitle: YouTube Channel
gridItems.quote: The deepest dives into backend engineering protocols you will find for free. His breakdown of gRPC vs REST is legendary.
gridItems.desc: Covers database internals, networking, proxies, and load balancing with incredible clarity.

gridItems.title: Pragmatic Engineer
gridItems.subtitle: Newsletter
gridItems.quote: Gergely Orosz provides the most accurate pulse on the tech market and senior engineering career paths.

gridItems.title: Postman
gridItems.subtitle: Dev Tool
gridItems.quote: Essential for API development. The team collaboration features have saved me countless hours of debugging.
gridItems.desc: API platform for building and using APIs. Simplifies each step of the lifecycle and streamlines collaboration.

gridItems.quote: The most immersive way to learn WebGL. If you want to make websites like this one, start here.

gridItems.title: Lex Fridman
gridItems.subtitle: Podcast
gridItems.quote: Long-form conversations that actually go deep into AI, physics, and life. A staple for my commute.
gridItems.desc: Conversations about the nature of intelligence, consciousness, love, and power.

gridItems.title: Warp
gridItems.subtitle: Terminal
gridItems.quote: The terminal reimagined for the 21st century. The AI command suggestions are surprisingly good.
